text.text_translated:
'Earthquake' means the ground shakes a lot.
The shaking can break buildings and bridges.
Luckily, bridges do not fall down often.
This is true, especially for modern bridges.
Engineers design bridges for places where the ground shakes.
They build on ground that does not move much.

best_attempt.text_translated:
An earthquake is when the ground shakes a lot.
Earthquakes can break buildings and bridges.
But bridges do not often fall down.
This is true for new bridges, especially.
Engineers now make bridges strong in earthquake areas.
They choose strong ground for the bridge.
The ground does not move much in an earthquake.
So the bridge stays up better.
